intro: Helianthemum nummularium var. roseum, commonly known as the rose-centered sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features dense clusters of small, rose-pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has fleshy, rounded leaves that are typically silver-green in color. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
